Directions: Refer to the passage(s) and image(s) shown, then answer each question that follows.
Title: Plates and Faults â€“ Part 1
Content: A class is studying where earthquakes and volcanoes occur on Earth. The teacher gives the students a map showing how Tennessee sits nearly in the middle of the North American Plate, far from the edges of the plate.

The students discuss how Tennessee should have few earthquakes or volcanoes given the distance of the state from the edges of the plate. They then look at another map that includes fault lines in Tennessee with seismic activity.

The map shows that both western and eastern Tennessee have had several earthquakes in two different areas. The students learn that the New Madrid Seismic Zone and Southern Appalachian Seismic Zone are currently active.
